translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
. The Chapter with Yasas
The Elder Vajjīputta’s Birth Story
“The Fortunate One, with a thousand spokes,
self-existent, unconquered,
after emerging from seclusion,
went out for his alms round.
Seeing him with a fruit in my hand,🔽I approached the Lord of Men;
with a confident mind, happy,
I gave him the fruit with the stone.
For ninety-four aeons,
the fruit that I gave then,
I do not recall a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving the fruit.
My defilements have been burned up,
I live undefiled.
It was surely a good thing for me,
I have done what the Awakened One said.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Vajjīputta recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā vajjīputto thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Vajjīputtattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā vajjīputto theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽vajjīputta therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Vajjīputta’s Birth Story is the fifth.
